title: Crowds gather in Australia to ring in the new year | ABC NEWS
description: Revellers are jostling to secure a prime spot to enjoy celebrations taking place across Australia to mark the start of 2026. Sydney's celebrations will feature special tributes to the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack. title: Aussies celebrating the new year in 1961 | ABC NEWS
description: In 1961, revellers celebrated the new year on Sydney’s Darlinghurst Road, with a jazz band striking up Auld Lang Syne. title: The headline-making stories in Tasmania in 2025 | ABC NEWS
description: The stadium, Spirits ships and salmon — three of the biggest news stories in Tasmania during 2025. A bushfire destroyed a beachside community, there was a breakthrough in a missing person search and the Hurricanes won the WBBL. title: Re-Spin: how Dyson Daniels quit 'fitting in' to reach new heights
description: In 2024, young Australian Dyson Daniels was in the second year of his NBA career and struggling to make a mark. He had a nagging sense he wasn't quite being true to himself. A trade from New Orleans to Atlanta has coincided with a meteoric rise. The 22-year-old opens up in an expansive interview. Featured: Dyson Daniels, Atlanta Hawks.   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Australian cities ring in 2026 with stunning firework displays | ABC NEWS
description: Major Australian capital cities have rung in 2026 and farewelled 2025 with spectacular firework displays.  More than a million revellers paused for a minute of silence on Sydney Harbour before nine tonnes of pyrotechnics lit up the night sky, while other major cities reported their biggest ever firework displays. title: Severe weather eases across northwest Queensland | ABC NEWS
description: Graziers are beginning to assess their losses as the severe weather system that caused widespread flooding across northwest Queensland begins to ease. A number of communities will remain isolated by floodwaters for weeks – a common occurrence during the wet season. title: Five Australian passengers safe after deadly train crash in Peru | ABC NEWS
description: Five Australians were among those on board two trains which collided head-on in Peru. One of the train drivers was killed while dozens of passengers were injured. Jo Needham, who suffered whiplash, says time ‘slowed down’ during the head-on crash between the Inca Rail S.A. and PeruRail S.A. trains near the popular tourist destination of Machu Picchu. The Department of Foreign Affairs says all five Australians are safe. title: US military launches fresh strikes on alleged drug-smuggling convoy | ABC NEWS
description: The US military says it has carried out air strikes on three alleged drug-smuggling vessels in international waters as the Trump administration continues to ramp up pressure on Venezuela’s Maduro government.  The Department of Defense claims it contacted the US Coast Guard to initiate a search and rescue mission in the wake of the attack.  The move signals a willingness to comply with international rules of engagements after allegations the US military targeted survivors of a vessel it had struck earlier.  At least 33 boats have been hit and 110 people killed in military strikes in the Caribbean and the Pacific Ocean amid US President Donald Trump’s so-called war on drugs. title: China imposes 55% tariff on some Australian beef imports | ABC NEWS
description: China has imposed an additional 55 per cent tariff on beef imports that exceed quota levels, dealing a blow to Australian exporters. China says the move is based on safeguarding its own domestic market. Tim Ryan, the CEO of Australian Meat Industry Council, says the new measure will effectively cease trade as no one can afford a 55 per cent tax on top of the price of beef. title: How the world rang in the new year in 2026 | ABC NEWS
description: Countries around the world have farewelled 2025 and celebrated the beginning of a new year with their own pyrotechnic extravaganzas.  New Zealand kickstarted the festivities with Asian countries following soon after.  Europe lit up their landmarks including the Arc de Triomphe while the London Eye was the focal point of England's New Year's celebrations. Meanwhile, Ukrainian and Russian residents prayed for peace in the New Year. title: Man charged over out-of-control bushfire in Western Australia | ABC NEWS
description: A man has been charged by police for allegedly sparking an emergency-level bushfire in the Perth Hills that left thousands of people without power and threatened lives and homes. Arson squad detectives have charged a 19-year-old man with breach of duty after he allegedly threw a firecracker into dry grass, igniting the blaze. title: Two drown, two missing as dangerous surf rocks Sydney beaches | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities are warning people in Sydney to stay out of the water as dangerous surf rocks the city's beaches. A search is underway after a man was swept out to sea at Coogee Beach. Meanwhile, a 25-year-old woman who was swept off rocks at Maroubra Beach could not be revived.
